title.narrative: Voice & Visibility for Southern African LGBTI Activists Through Copenhagen 2021 World Pride Activities

1. Coordinated inclusion of voices of LGBTI activists from eSwatini, Mauritius, Malawi, Botswana, Angola, and South Africa in Copenhagen 2021 World Pride deliberations about advocacy for legal equality and economic inclusion of LGBTI people
INDICATOR: Number of southern African LGBTI activists that have active voice and visibility in Copenhagen World Pride activities

1. Coordinated inclusion of voices of LGBTI activists from eSwatini, Mauritius, Malawi, Botswana, Angola, and South Africa in Copenhagen 2021 World Pride deliberations about advocacy for legal equality and economic inclusion of LGBTI people
INDICATOR: Number of southern African LGBTI activists that have active voice and visibility in Copenhagen World Pride activities

2. Increased collaboration amongst LGBTI activists from eSwatini, Mauritius, Malawi, Botswana, Angola, and South Africa in social equality litigation and advocacy for economic inclusion
INDICATOR: Number of opportunities available for national and regional level strategic learning and planning amongst different southern African LGBTI and ally groups about social equality litigation and advocacy for economic inclusion

2. Increased collaboration amongst LGBTI activists from eSwatini, Mauritius, Malawi, Botswana, Angola, and South Africa in social equality litigation and advocacy for economic inclusion
INDICATOR: Number of opportunities available for national and regional level strategic learning and planning amongst different southern African LGBTI and ally groups about social equality litigation and advocacy for economic inclusion
